What is a fractal?

July 7th , 2012
[...] Fractals are typically self-similar patterns, where self-similar means they are "the same from near as from far". [...] The definition of fractal goes beyond self-similarity per se to exclude trivial self-similarity and include the idea of a detailed pattern repeating itself.

Source: Fractal, Wikipedia

Examples

The Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute made an applet which allows you to create fractals by yourself. So I've tried this one as a starter: [caption id="attachment_29991" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Martin Fractal #1[/caption] [caption id="attachment_30001" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Martin Fractal #2[/caption] [caption id="attachment_30011" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Martin Fractal #3[/caption]

You might know this one: [caption id="attachment_30031" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Snowflake fractal #1[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30041" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Snowflake fractal #2[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30051" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Snowflake fractal #3[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30061" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Snowflake fractal #4[/caption]

Fractals in Nature

Fractals seem to appear quite often in nature. I have just re-created one that I have seen recently: [caption id="attachment_30081" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #1[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30091" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #2[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30101" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #3[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30111" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #4[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30121" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #5[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30131" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #6[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_30141" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Leaf fractal #9[/caption]

Mandelbrot set

The Mandelbrot set is maybe the best known fractal, although it is not a fractal in my opinion. It does never repeat itself.
